title: Addams on vote for women - compare

content.question: Addams’ ideas expressed in the excerpt have most in common with which of the following historical views about women?

choices.label: The seventeenth-century Puritan belief that women must be governed by their husbands and fathers
The belief of some mid-nineteenth-century reformers that women could act as the moral voice in society
The argument of some nineteenth-century advice books that women’s sphere was restricted to the home and family
The rejection of traditional gender roles by feminists in the mid-twentieth century

content.answer: The belief of some mid-nineteenth-century reformers that women could act as the moral voice in society

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
